main event: A witness reported observing a single unidentified flying object in Monroe, Ohio on August 30, 1961, for about 2 minutes and 25 seconds.
interesting points: The object was possibly mistaken for the exhaust trail of a jet aircraft., The observer estimated the object's speed to be about three times that of a jet fighter., The witness was an amateur rocketeer aged 14., The object appeared very bright and shiny at first, resembling a star., A newspaper article discussed a similar sighting in Cincinnati on August 31, 1961.
